title: ASX sags before CPI; Costa Group slammed
text:
Sarah Turner

Morgan Stanley strategists said that the "worst-case scenarios" of spiralling trade tensions and a "no deal" Brexit are likely "off the table."

Central banks have also collectively again started to meaningfully expand their balance sheets, they said, "which looks to underpin a gradual return to global growth later in 2020."

However, they said that they remain defensively positioned.

"Until we see equity markets reset their expectations, given the anaemic

corporate profit growth outlook and high valuations, we continue to prescribe a defensive posture favouring Australia," they said.

They like the Australian market "for its defensive properties and duration as well as to mitigate against market drawdown."
description: The ASX starts on a downbeat note with Costa shares falling 26 per cent; Woolworths flags a $200m-300m charge from underpaying staff; CPI due out at 11.30am.
